long: Meaning: to "nod", i.e. "waver"; figuratively, to "wander", "flee", "disappear"; also (from shaking the head in sympathy), to "console", "deplore", or (from tossing the head in scorn) "taunt".  Usage: bemoan, flee, get, mourn, make to move, take pity, remove, shake, skip for joy, be sorry, vagabond, way, wandering.  Source: a primitive root;
